data.title: BELGIUM
data.text:
LIST OF BELGIAN SOVEREIGNS FROM 1831

KINGDOM OF BELGIUM FROM 1830/31:

HOUSE OF SAXE-COBURG

1831-1865: LEOPOLD I

Born in 1790 in Coburg.

Father: Duke Francis I of Saxe-Coburg-Saalfeld. Mother: Duchess Augusta of Reuss-Ebersdorf.

Married firstly in 1816 in London Princess Charlotte of Great Britain (*1796 London,+1817 London).

Married secondly in 1832 in CompiÃ¨gne/France Princess LOUISE MARIE of OrlÃ©ans (*1812 Palermo,+1850 Ostende).

He was never crowned.

His issue who reigned:

-LEOPOLD II (*1835,+1909; son of Louise-Marie),

-Charlotte (*1840,+1927; Empress of Mexico; daughter of Louise-Marie).

Died in 1865 in Laken.

Buried with his Queen Louise Marie in the Church of Our Lady of Laken in Brussels-Laken.

His first wife Princess Charlotte of Wales was buried in St George's Chapel in Windsor (England).

1865-1909: LEOPOLD II

Born in 1835 in Brussels.

Father: King Leopold I of the Belgians.

Mother: Queen Louise-Marie of OrlÃ©ans.

Married in 1853 in Brussels Archduchess MARIA HENRIETTA of Austria (*1836 Buda,+1902 Spa).

He was never crowned.

Died in 1909 in Laken.

Buried with his Queen Maria Henrietta in the Church of Our Lady of Laken in Brussels-Laken.

1909-1934: ALBERT I

Born in 1875 in Brussels.

Father: Prince Philippe, Count of Flanders.

Mother: Princess Marie of Hohenzollern.

Married in 1900 in Munich Duchess ELIZABETH of Bavaria (*1876 Possenhofen,+1965 Brussels).

He was never crowned.

His issue who reigned:

-LEOPOLD III (*1901,+1983),

-Marie-Jose (*1906,+2001; Queen of Italy).

Died in 1934 in Marche-les-Dames near Namur.

Buried with his Queen Elizabeth in the Church of Our Lady of Laken in Brussels-Laken.

1934-1951: LEOPOLD III

Born in 1901 in Brussels.

Father: King Albert I of the Belgians.

Mother: Queen Elizabeth of Bavaria.

Married firstly in 1926 in Stockholm (Protestant ceremony) and in Brussels (Catholic ceremony) Princess ASTRID of Sweden (*1905 Stockholm,+1935 KÃ¼ssnacht am Rigi, Switzerland).

Married secondly in 1941 in Laken Mary Lilian Baels (*1916 London,+2002 Waterloo; from 1941 Princess Lilian).

He was never crowned.

His issue who reigned:

-Josephine-Charlotte (*1927,+2005; Grand Duchess of Luxembourg; daughter of Astrid),

-BALDWIN (*1930,+1993; son of Astrid),

-ALBERT II (*1934; son of Astrid).

Exiled 1944-1950 in Austria and Switzerland. Abdicated in 1951 in Brussels.

Died in 1983 in Woluwe-Saint-Lambert near Brussels.

Buried with his Queen Astrid and Princess Lilian in the Church of Our Lady of Laken in Brussels-Laken.

1951-1993: BALDWIN (Boudewijn/Baudouin)

Born in 1930 in Laken near Brussels.

Father: King Leopold III of the Belgians.

Mother: Queen Astrid of Sweden.

Married in 1960 in Brussels DoÃ±a FABIOLA Mora y AragÃ³n (*1928 Madrid,+2014 Brussels).

He was never crowned.

Died in 1993 in Motril (Spain).

Buried with his Queen Fabiola in the Church of Our Lady of Laken in Brussels-Laken.

1993-2013: ALBERT II

Born in 1934 in Laken near Brussels.

Father: King Leopold III of the Belgians.

Mother: Queen Astrid of Sweden.

Married in 1959 in Brussels PAOLA Ruffo di Calabria (*1937 Forte dei Marmi).

He was never crowned. Abdicated in 2013 in Brussels.

His issue who reigned: PHILIP (*1960).

FROM 2013: PHILIP (Filip/Philippe)

Born in 1960 in Laken near Brussels.

Father: King Albert II of the Belgians.

Mother: Queen Paola.

Married in 1999 in Brussels MATHILDE d'Udekem d'Acoz (*1973 Uccle/Ukkel).

He was never crowned.

Issue of marriage: Elisabeth (*2001), Gabriel (*2003), Emmanuel (*2005), ElÃ©onore (2008).

TOMBS OF BELGIAN SOVEREIGNS

The tomb of King LEOPOLD I and his Queen LOUISE MARIE OF ORLÃANS in the Church of Our Lady of Laken, Brussels (Belgium)

The tomb of King LEOPOLD II and his Queen MARIA HENRIETTA OF AUSTRIA in the Church of Our Lady of Laken, Brussels (Belgium)

The tomb of King ALBERT I and his Queen ELIZABETH OF BAVARIA in the Church of Our Lady of Laken, Brussels (Belgium)

The tomb of King LEOPOLD III and his Queen ASTRID OF SWEDEN in the Church of Our Lady of Laken, Brussels (Belgium)

The tomb of King BALDWIN (Baudouin) and his Queen FABIOLA in the Church of Our Lady of Laken, Brussels (Belgium)
